intro: Allagosperma tayuya, commonly known as the Yucatán sand mat, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dry, arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in heads, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by wind. Allagosperma tayuya is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
